page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The survey area is largely rich {arable farmland.}The landscape is{ {undulating}with the 12 Km. block being roughly bisected by a{chalk {ridge}which is part of the eastern edge of the{Chilterns. There are two settlemets within the block: Ashwell and Newnham. {Newnham}is a small hamlet of about 50 people and is dominated by two large farmhouses whose owners control much of the land in the area. {Ashwell}is a former{medieval market centre which has declined in the modern period but is now a wealthy {commuter village }of about 2500 people.The village is quiet and pretty and has many buildings of historical interest.It is an educational centre for schools and attracts a few adult tourists and day visitors as well.
